wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the pukpara system. Explain its purpose as a unified operations workspace for agricultural cooperatives, VSLAs, and farming organizations with multi-tenancy support. Describe the core functionality including farmer/farm management, inventory control, marketplace transactions, and financial operations. Document the relationship between frontend (Next.js App Router) and backend (tRPC, Drizzle ORM) components. Include architectural context, primary user roles (Admin, Organization Owner, Farmer), and key workflows such as organization approval and farmer onboarding. Provide high-level diagrams illustrating system context and data flow. Make the content accessible to beginners while including technical depth for developers evaluating the system architecture.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the tRPC-based API endpoints in pukpara. Document the routing structure, procedure definitions, and type-safe request/response contracts. Explain how tRPC routers are composed in root.ts and mounted via the Next.js App Router API route. Detail input validation using Zod or runtime checks, error formatting, and context propagation (e.g., authentication state). Include examples of calling these endpoints from the frontend using tRPC React hooks. Address endpoint security, rate limiting considerations, and versioning strategy. Provide guidance on adding new endpoints while maintaining type safety and separation of concerns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the component architecture of pukpara's frontend. Explain the atomic design principles applied in organizing UI components into layout, composite, and primitive levels. Describe the role of layout components (header, sidebar, dashboard-layout) in structuring application views and maintaining consistent navigation. Document the implementation of reusable UI primitives (button, form, table) using Radix UI and Tailwind CSS. Include examples of component composition patterns from actual pages like /admin/farmers and /app/farmers/[farmerId]/farms. Address accessibility features, responsive behavior, and theming integration via next-themes and ThemeProvider. Illustrate how layout and UI components interact with authentication state and dynamic routing.

wiki_catalogs.name: User & Organization Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the User and Organization entities in the pukpara database. Detail field definitions, data types, constraints, and indexes for both tables. Explain the multi-tenancy implementation where organizationId serves as a foreign key across tenant-specific data. Document the relationship between User and Organization through the member table, including role-based access control via ORGANIZATION_MEMBER_ROLE. Describe status workflows (PENDING, APPROVED) and KYC verification states. Illustrate how session management ties to active organization context. Include practical examples of querying users within an organization and handling organization membership changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Roles & Permissions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the user role hierarchy and permission system in pukpara. Explain the three-tier role structure: Admin, Support Admin, and Member, and their respective access levels across tenant and organization contexts. Document how permissions are implemented using utility functions in admin-permissions.ts and org-permissions.ts, including helper functions like isSuperAdmin, isSupportAdmin, and hasOrgPermission. Describe the integration of these permissions with UI components to conditionally render features and with API routes to enforce data access control. Provide code examples showing permission checks in both frontend components and tRPC middleware. Address common issues such as permission escalation risks and debugging access denials.

wiki_catalogs.name: Districts API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Districts tRPC router in pukpara. Detail each procedure including listDistricts, getDistrictById, and any CRUD operations available. Document request parameters, response schemas, and authentication requirements (must be admin role). Explain how this router integrates with the reference data management system in the admin settings. Include real code examples from the codebase showing server-side implementation and client-side invocation using tRPC hooks like useQuery. Describe the use case for district data in organization setup and farmer registration. Address error handling scenarios such as invalid district IDs and permission denied cases. Provide guidance on extending the router with new procedures while maintaining type safety and performance optimization through proper indexing in the database.

wiki_catalogs.name: Multi-Tenant Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the multi-tenancy implementation in pukpara. Describe how data isolation is achieved through organizationId foreign keys across core entities such as users, farmers, farms, and financial records. Explain the role of Better Auth in managing organization-scoped sessions and tenant context switching. Document the server-side middleware and tRPC middlewares that enforce tenant boundaries. Include details on organization creation workflows (admin-initiated and self-service), approval processes, and membership management. Illustrate with examples from src/features/admin/organizations components and hooks. Address security considerations, query scoping patterns, and cross-tenant access prevention mechanisms. Provide guidance on extending tenant-aware features and common pitfalls in multi-tenant data handling.

wiki_catalogs.name: Email Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the email integration system in pukpara using Resend. Explain the implementation of the Resend email service in src/server/email/resend.ts, including configuration, template rendering, and asynchronous delivery patterns. Document the structure and usage of email templates such as organization-approved-email.tsx and password-reset-email.tsx, highlighting dynamic data injection and JSX-to-HTML transformation. Provide examples of how email triggers are integrated into business workflows like organization approval and password reset. Include error handling, retry strategies, and logging mechanisms. Address security considerations such as template injection prevention and PII handling. Offer configuration guidelines for API keys, sender domains, and testing environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Districts API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Districts API router in pukpara. Detail all exposed tRPC procedures including list, create, update, and delete operations for district entities. Explain the input validation schema, authentication requirements, and role-based access control using org-permissions. Document the database interaction pattern via Drizzle ORM and integration with reference data management in the admin settings. Include examples of frontend invocation using tRPC React hooks from the settings/reference/districts page. Describe error handling, response formats, and usage within the organization onboarding workflow. Address performance considerations for geo-reference data loading and caching strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Savings Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Savings Management sub-feature. Explain the implementation of individual and group savings accounts, including the SavingsAccount and SavingsEntry entities in the data model. Document how deposits, withdrawals, and balance calculations are handled with transactional integrity. Describe the UI components used for recording savings entries and displaying transaction histories. Include examples from the codebase showing form validation with Zod and state management using React Hook Form. Explain role-based access control for financial officers and audit logging of all savings transactions. Address common issues such as reconciliation errors and provide troubleshooting guidance. Highlight performance optimization strategies for handling high-frequency savings operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Organization Lifecycle Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the organization lifecycle management system in pukpara. Thoroughly explain the multi-step organization creation workflow, including both admin-initiated and self-service registration paths. Document the state management via organization-create-store using Zustand, and how form data is persisted across steps (creation mode, user selection, organization details, review). Include concrete examples from the step components and organization-create-page, detailing prop drilling, validation patterns, and submission handling. Explain the approval process post-creation and integration with Better Auth for tenant provisioning. Address common issues such as incomplete submissions, duplicate organization names, and email verification failures. Provide guidance on extending the workflow with additional steps or custom validation rules.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the pukpara technology stack. Detail the primary frameworks: Next.js (App Router) for frontend routing and rendering, tRPC for end-to-end type-safe APIs, Drizzle ORM for PostgreSQL database interactions, Better Auth for authentication with multi-tenancy, UploadThing for file uploads, and Resend for email delivery. Explain the role of supporting libraries like Tailwind CSS for styling, React Hook Form for form management, and Zod for schema validation. Document version compatibility, dependency relationships, and rationale for technology choices. Include configuration examples from next.config.ts and tsconfig.json. Address how these technologies work together to enable type safety, developer experience, and scalability.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Backend
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the backend authentication system powered by Better Auth. Explain the implementation of authentication strategies, session management, and organization-based multi-tenancy. Document the API route handler in auth/[...all] that integrates with Better Auth's modular authentication flow. Describe server-side utilities in auth-server.ts for session validation, user context extraction, and tenant scoping. Include details on password reset, email verification, and admin approval workflows. Provide examples of customizing authentication flows and extending user metadata. Address security practices such as token expiration, CSRF protection, and secure cookie configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing & Navigation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the routing and navigation system in pukpara using Next.js App Router. Detail the implementation of route groups ((admin), (app), (auth)) and their impact on URL structure, layout isolation, and access control. Explain the nested layout strategy and how layouts are shared across administrative, user-facing, and authentication routes. Document the client-side navigation patterns using Next.js Link and navigation state management. Provide examples of protected routes, role-based navigation filtering in the sidebar, and dynamic route parameters (e.g., [farmerId], [organizationId]). Include guidance on adding new routes, handling route transitions, and integrating with authentication workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Farmer & Farm Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Farmer and Farm data models. Explain the farmer entity's attributes including personal details, identification, and community information, emphasizing the pukparaId as a business identifier. Detail the farm entity's geographic and agricultural metadata, including acreage, crop type, and GPS coordinates. Describe the one-to-many relationship between farmers and farms, and the use of farmCoordinate for precision mapping. Explain teamFarmer for group affiliations (VSLAs, cooperatives). Provide examples of querying all farms for a farmer, calculating total cultivated area, and retrieving yield history by season. Address data validation rules and soft delete patterns using isDeleted flags.

wiki_catalogs.name: Organization Management & Access Control
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for organization-based access control in pukpara. Explain how multi-tenancy is enforced through organizationId scoping across database models and API layers. Document the organization membership lifecycle: invitation, approval, role assignment (owner, admin, member), and revocation. Describe the implementation of organization context switching in the frontend and how the currentOrg store maintains session state. Detail the security measures preventing cross-tenant data leakage, including database-level filtering and tRPC middleware validation. Provide examples from the organization creation flow and membership management pages. Address edge cases such as orphaned records and concurrent organization switching.

wiki_catalogs.name: Organizations API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the Organizations tRPC router in pukpara. Document all procedures including createOrganization, getOrganizationById, updateOrganization, listOrganizations, approveOrganization, and membership management functions. For each endpoint, specify request parameters, validation rules, response types, and required permissions (admin vs org-level access). Explain the multi-tenancy implications and how organizationId enforces data isolation. Include practical examples from the codebase showing both server-side logic and client usage via tRPC. Detail the approval workflow integration and how it affects organization status transitions. Cover error conditions like duplicate names, invalid licenses, and quota limits. Provide best practices for securely extending the API with new organization-related features while maintaining compliance with audit and logging requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Farmer Management System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Farmer Management feature. Explain the domain model including Farmer, Farm, and associated KYC and yield tracking data. Document the UI components and page structure for listing, viewing, and creating farmers within the member-facing application. Describe integration with tRPC hooks for data fetching and form submission. Include implementation details on GPS coordinate handling for farms, seasonal yield tracking, and relationship management with VSLAs or teams. Highlight usage of reusable UI components like data tables and forms. Provide examples from the codebase showing how farmer creation flows are structured and how data is persisted through Drizzle ORM. Address common issues such as incomplete farmer profiles and strategies for data validation.

wiki_catalogs.name: File Upload Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the file upload infrastructure in pukpara powered by UploadThing. Explain the API route implementation in src/app/api/uploadthing/route.ts and the core configuration in core.ts, including file type validation, size limits, and storage configuration. Document the integration layer in src/lib/uploadthing.ts that connects frontend components with the UploadThing backend. Describe the security model, including authentication checks, file access controls, and virus scanning considerations. Provide usage examples for uploading farmer documents, farm images, and inventory assets. Include error handling for failed uploads, network interruptions, and invalid file types. Address performance optimization through chunked uploads and CDN integration, as well as monitoring upload success rates and troubleshooting common issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Organizations API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the Organizations API router in pukpara. Document all tRPC procedures for organization lifecycle management including creation, retrieval, update, approval workflows, and membership operations. Explain the integration with Better Auth for tenant creation, session context propagation, and multi-tenancy enforcement. Detail input validation using Zod schemas, data sanitization, and audit logging on state changes. Describe relationships with user management, subscription licensing, and admin approval workflows. Provide concrete examples of calling these endpoints from both admin and self-service sign-up flows. Include information on rate limiting, security middleware, and data isolation guarantees across tenants. Address common issues such as duplicate organization names, approval status transitions, and error recovery.

wiki_catalogs.name: Loan Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Loan Processing sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the lifecycle of a loan from application to disbursement and repayment, focusing on the Loan and LoanRepayment entities. Document approval workflows, risk assessment rules, and interest calculation logic. Describe how loan eligibility is determined based on savings history and credit policies. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing form handling, validation, and integration with tRPC APIs. Explain how repayments are scheduled and tracked, including handling of late payments. Address integration with the notification system for payment reminders and describe audit trails for all loan modifications. Provide guidance on handling edge cases like partial repayments or loan write-offs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tenant Context Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for tenant context management in pukpara. Describe how the current organization context is established and maintained across the application using Better Auth's session mechanisms and custom auth clients. Explain the role of layout components in rendering tenant-scoped navigation and how organization switching is handled in the sidebar. Document the use of tRPC middlewares to inject organizationId into server-side calls and enforce tenant scoping. Include examples from use-organization-list-controller and use-organization-filters hooks that manage filtered data access based on tenant boundaries. Address security considerations around context leakage, race conditions during switching, and session invalidation. Provide implementation guidelines for new features to correctly respect the active tenant context.

wiki_catalogs.name: Directory Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the pukpara directory structure. Break down the organization of the codebase into logical units: src/app for Next.js App Router pages, src/components for reusable UI elements, src/features for domain-specific functionality, src/lib for core utilities, src/server for backend logic, and root-level configuration files. Explain the purpose of each top-level directory and significant subdirectories. Document the feature-sliced architecture in src/features and component categorization in src/components/ui. Include examples of file naming conventions and routing patterns (e.g., [param] syntax). Highlight how the structure supports maintainability and developer onboarding.

wiki_catalogs.name: Business Logic Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the business logic layer in pukpara's backend. Thoroughly explain how business rules are implemented within tRPC routers for entities like districts and organizations. Document service patterns used to separate business logic from API routing, including data validation, transaction handling, and domain-specific workflows (e.g., organization approval). Include concrete examples from districts.ts and organizations.ts showing how input sanitization, access control, and side effects (e.g., email triggers) are managed. Explain the role of utility functions in src/lib/utils.ts and how they support business operations. Address error handling strategies, logging practices, and integration with external services.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the state management strategies in pukpara. Explain the use of Zustand for form state management in complex workflows like organization creation and user sign-up. Document the implementation of custom React hooks (use-debounce, use-mobile) for common state logic. Describe how client-side authentication state is managed via auth-client and synchronized across components. Illustrate state flow between tRPC query results, React components, and form stores. Provide examples of state persistence, error handling in form workflows, and reactivity patterns. Address performance considerations such as memoization, state colocation, and avoiding unnecessary re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Financial Operations Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the financial operations in pukpara, focusing on savingsAccount, savingsEntry, loan, loanRepayment, and inputCredit. Detail how savings accounts support both individual farmers and teams with balance tracking and contribution history. Explain the loan lifecycle from request to repayment, including interest rate, term days, and approval workflows. Document the inputCredit system for supplier-issued credit to farmers or teams. Include database constraints such as check clauses for positive amounts and valid status transitions. Provide examples of calculating outstanding loan balances, generating repayment schedules, and auditing financial transactions across entities.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Key Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the API key management system in pukpara. Explain how API keys are generated, stored, and validated for programmatic access to the platform's tRPC endpoints. Document the implementation in auth-admin-client.ts for secure key transmission and the backend validation logic within organization routers. Describe the UI flow in the admin settings for creating, listing, and revoking API keys with proper audit logging. Include details on key expiration policies, scope limitations, and rate limiting considerations. Provide usage examples for external integrations and highlight security best practices such as encryption at rest and access logging. Address common issues like key leakage and rotation strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Financial Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Financial Operations module. Detail the implementation of savings accounts, loan management, input credit systems, and payment tracking. Explain the data model relationships between SavingsAccount, SavingsEntry, Loan, LoanRepayment, and PurchaseOrder entities. Document role-based access control for financial officers and approval workflows for transactions. Describe how financial operations integrate with inventory and marketplace modules. Include examples of form state management using React Hook Form and Zod validation schemas. Highlight audit logging practices for financial changes and reconciliation processes. Discuss performance considerations for transaction-heavy operations and strategies for ensuring data consistency across financial records.

wiki_catalogs.name: External Service Integrations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for potential and extensible external service integration points in pukpara. Document existing hooks for SMS providers in authentication flows, particularly during user sign-up and OTP verification, with reference to step-two-form.tsx and auth.ts. Outline the architecture for payment gateway integrations in financial operations such as savings deposits, loan repayments, and marketplace transactions. Describe extension points for external data services like weather APIs, market price feeds, and agricultural advisory systems. Explain the middleware and adapter patterns used to decouple third-party services from core business logic. Provide implementation guidelines for secure credential management, rate limiting, circuit breaking, and fallback strategies. Include examples of webhook handling, asynchronous processing, and idempotency in service communication.

wiki_catalogs.name: Input Credit System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Input Credit System sub-feature. Explain how farmers and organizations are extended credit for agricultural inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Detail the relationship between PurchaseOrder, Inventory, and Financial modules in managing credit terms and fulfillment. Document approval workflows for credit requests and risk assessment mechanisms. Include examples from the codebase showing how credit limits are enforced and how disbursements are linked to inventory movements. Describe reconciliation processes between credit issued and repayments collected. Address integration with supplier accounts and marketplace listings. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like credit limit miscalculations or fulfillment mismatches.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Isolation Patterns
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the data isolation patterns implemented in pukpara. Detail how every core entity (users, farmers, farms, financial records, inventory) enforces multi-tenancy through organizationId foreign keys in the database schema. Explain query scoping strategies at both the ORM (Drizzle) and API (tRPC) layers to prevent cross-tenant data access. Include examples from organizations router and data-table implementations showing filtered queries and server-side pagination. Document constraints, indexes on organizationId fields, and performance implications of tenant-scoped queries. Address common vulnerabilities such as IDOR (Insecure Direct Object References) and how middleware validation prevents them. Provide best practices for writing tenant-aware queries and testing data isolation in development.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend architecture of pukpara. Describe the Next.js App Router implementation with route groups ((admin), (app), (auth)) and their routing behavior. Explain the component architecture using atomic design principles with layout components (header, sidebar) and primitive UI components (button, form, table). Document the use of React Server Components, client-server component boundaries, and data fetching patterns. Include details on theme management via next-themes, responsive design using Tailwind CSS, and accessibility implementation. Illustrate component composition patterns and state management strategies across the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Access Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Data Access Layer using Drizzle ORM. Detail how database schema is defined in schema.ts with tables for users, organizations, farmers, farms, financial records, and inventory. Explain the use of Drizzle's query builder for type-safe database operations and transaction management. Document the database connection setup in index.ts, including connection pooling and error handling. Illustrate common data access patterns such as fetching organization-scoped records, handling relational data, and performing batch operations. Include performance considerations like indexing strategies, query optimization, and efficient data loading techniques. Address database migration practices using Drizzle Kit and version control integration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for form handling in pukpara. Detail the implementation using React Hook Form with Zod validation schemas (e.g., auth schema). Explain the multi-step form architecture used in sign-up and organization creation workflows, including state persistence between steps and validation strategies. Document the integration between UI form components (input, phone-input, async-select) and form state management. Provide examples of dynamic form behavior, error display patterns, and accessibility features. Include best practices for handling file uploads in forms via UploadThing integration and managing complex nested data structures. Address common issues like validation edge cases and performance optimization for large forms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Inventory & Warehouse Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the inventory and warehouse data models. Explain the commodity and commodityVariety hierarchy for agricultural products. Describe warehouse entities with capacity and location metadata. Detail stockLot for inventory tracking with batch numbers, expiry dates, and cost basis. Explain stockMovement for recording inventory changes (in/out/adjustment) with audit trails. Highlight relationships between stock lots and purchase order fulfillment. Provide examples of checking warehouse utilization, identifying expiring inventory, and tracing stock origins. Address data integrity constraints and indexing strategies for performance optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Inventory & Warehouse Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Inventory Management sub-system. Explain the hierarchy of Commodities, Varieties, Warehouses, and StockLots, including tracking of expiry dates and stock movements. Document the UI architecture for inventory administration including data tables, filtering, and pagination controls. Describe integration with tRPC for real-time inventory updates and conflict resolution during concurrent adjustments. Include implementation details on warehouse capacity tracking, stock lot lifecycle management, and inventory reporting. Provide code examples from commodity and variety management pages. Address common issues such as stock count discrepancies and strategies for inventory reconciliation and audit trails.

wiki_catalogs.name: Payment Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Payment Tracking sub-feature. Explain how all financial inflows and outflows are recorded and monitored across savings, loans, and marketplace transactions. Document the unified payment interface used by administrators to view and manage payments. Describe the data model relationships between payments, transactions, and ledger entries. Include examples from the codebase showing filtering, search, and bulk operations on payment records. Explain integration with external systems for payment verification and reconciliation. Address audit requirements, data retention policies, and reporting capabilities. Provide guidance on handling failed payments, refunds, and chargebacks within the system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the backend architecture of pukpara. Describe the tRPC-based API design with end-to-end type safety, router composition in root.ts, and request handling via the App Router API route. Explain the server-side data access layer using Drizzle ORM and direct database queries. Document the separation between API endpoints, business logic, and data persistence. Include details on error handling, input validation, and security measures implemented at the API layer. Illustrate the data flow from HTTP request to database and back to client, highlighting type safety guarantees throughout the stack.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the styling strategy in pukpara using Tailwind CSS and component-level styling. Explain the configuration in postcss.config.mjs and Tailwind setup for utility-first styling. Document the use of global CSS resets in globals.css and how component styles are composed using Tailwind classes. Describe the implementation of dark mode via next-themes and theme-provider. Illustrate responsive design patterns using Tailwind breakpoints and mobile-first classes. Provide examples of custom component styling (e.g., button variants, card layouts) and how design tokens are maintained. Address accessibility considerations in color contrast, focus states, and motion preferences.

wiki_catalogs.name: Marketplace & Purchase Orders Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the marketplace and purchase order system. Detail marketplaceListing for seller inventory exposure with pricing and availability. Explain purchaseOrder and purchaseOrderItem for buyer-initiated transactions, including payment terms and deferred payment options. Describe delivery for shipment tracking with geolocation and waybill data. Document receipt and payment entities for financial settlement. Illustrate the end-to-end flow from listing to payment with status transitions. Include examples of matching listings to purchase orders, calculating fulfillment rates, and reconciling payments against receipts. Address referential integrity and transactional consistency across related entities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Marketplace & Purchase Orders
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Marketplace feature. Describe the implementation of product listings, purchase order creation, approval workflows, and delivery tracking. Explain the data model relationships between Listing, PurchaseOrder, Supplier, and Receipt entities. Document the UI components for managing marketplace transactions and how they integrate with financial and inventory systems. Include details on order status transitions, payment processing integration points, and receipt generation. Highlight the use of state machines for order lifecycle management and notification triggers for status changes. Provide examples from the purchase order management interface and discuss scalability considerations for high-volume marketplace operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Model & Database Schema
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the pukpara database schema. Detail the primary entities: User, Organization, Farmer, Farm, SavingsAccount, Loan, Commodity, Warehouse, StockLot, PurchaseOrder, and their relationships. Document field definitions, data types, primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints for each table. Explain the multi-tenancy implementation using organizationId foreign keys across entities. Include database schema diagrams and sample data relationships. Address data access patterns, query performance considerations, and transactional boundaries. Document data validation rules and business logic enforced at the database level.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit & Compliance
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Audit & Compliance system. Explain the implementation of audit logging for critical operations across organizations, users, and financial transactions. Document the database schema for audit events and how they are captured through database triggers or application-level hooks. Describe the UI for viewing audit trails, including filtering, search, and export capabilities. Include integration with Better Auth for tracking authentication events and session changes. Highlight compliance features such as immutable logs, retention policies, and access controls for audit data. Provide examples from the admin audit page and discuss strategies for forensic analysis and regulatory reporting.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication & Authorization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the authentication and authorization system in pukpara. Explain the Better Auth implementation with multi-tenancy support, session management, and organization-based access control. Document the role hierarchy (Admin, Support Admin, Member) and permission systems for both admin and organization contexts. Describe the authentication flows: user sign-up with multi-step forms, admin approval workflows, password reset, and API key management. Include implementation details of permission checking utilities and their integration with UI components. Provide examples of protected routes and data access restrictions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Feature-Specific Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the feature-specific implementation in pukpara. Describe the feature-sliced architecture pattern used in src/features with domain-specific modules for admin, farmers, farms, and organizations. Explain the internal structure of each feature directory including components, hooks, and stores. Document the integration between feature components and tRPC hooks for data fetching. Include details on form state management, UI patterns, and business logic encapsulation within each feature. Highlight cross-feature interactions and shared dependencies.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the tRPC endpoints in pukpara. Document each router (districts, organizations) with their procedures, request parameters, response types, and authentication requirements. Explain the tRPC request/response cycle and type safety benefits. Include examples of client-side invocation using tRPC hooks. Document error handling patterns, rate limiting considerations, and versioning strategy. Provide guidance on extending the API with new endpoints and maintaining type consistency. Address debugging techniques for API issues and monitoring approaches.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Points
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the integration points in pukpara. Document the email integration using Resend with template implementation in email/templates. Explain the file upload infrastructure with UploadThing, including configuration, security considerations, and usage patterns. Describe potential integration points for SMS providers, payment gateways, and external data services. Include implementation details of integration hooks and error handling. Provide configuration guidelines and security best practices for third-party services. Address monitoring and logging for integration health.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment & Environment Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for deployment and environment configuration of pukpara. Document the Cloudflare deployment strategy using OpenNext, environment variable management, and infrastructure requirements. Explain configuration in next.config.ts and open-next.config.ts for optimal performance and security. Detail the environment setup process, including database configuration, authentication secrets, and third-party service credentials. Provide deployment workflows, rollback procedures, and monitoring setup. Include scaling considerations and cost optimization strategies for the target infrastructure.

wiki_catalogs.name: Developer Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the developer guide of pukpara. Provide step-by-step instructions for setting up the development environment, including dependencies installation, database setup, and environment configuration. Document the database migration workflow using Drizzle ORM and schema management practices. Explain the use of custom hooks in src/hooks/ and their integration patterns. Include testing strategy, debugging techniques, and contribution guidelines. Provide examples of common development tasks like adding new features, extending APIs, and modifying the database schema.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: Pukpara Platform

## 1. Project Introduction

The Pukpara Platform is a unified operations workspace designed to manage agricultural and organizational workflows in a multi-tenant environment. Built as a modern full-stack Next.js application, it supports complex domain models including farmers, farms, inventory, marketplace transactions, and financial operations such as savings, loans, and input credit systems.

The core goals of the platform are to:
- Enable efficient management of agricultural cooperatives, VSLAs, and farming organizations
- Provide robust administrative controls for tenant onboarding and approval workflows
- Support comprehensive inventory and marketplace operations
- Facilitate financial inclusion through integrated savings, loan, and payment systems

The target audience includes agricultural cooperatives, aggregators, development organizations, and government agencies managing rural farming communities across regions and districts.

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

Pukpara follows a layered architecture combining Next.js App Router, tRPC for type-safe APIs, Drizzle ORM for database access, and Better Auth for authentication with multi-tenancy support.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[Client] --> B[Next.js App Router]
  B --> C[tRPC API Layer]
  C --> D[Server Logic]
  D --> E[Drizzle ORM]
  E --> F[(PostgreSQL Database)]
  G[Better Auth] --> C
  H[UploadThing] --> C
  I[Resend] --> J[Email Templates]
```

### Design Patterns

The application employs several key architectural patterns:

- **Multi-tenancy**: Organizations act as tenants with data isolation enforced through `organizationId` foreign keys across domain entities.
- **Type-safe APIs**: tRPC enables end-to-end type safety between client and server with shared TypeScript types.
- **Domain-Driven Design**: Clear separation of concerns with dedicated tables for farmer, inventory, marketplace, and financial domains.
- **Event-Driven Hooks**: Better Auth's `databaseHooks` allow triggering business logic (e.g., auto-organization creation) on user creation.

### Data Flow

```mermaid
flowchart LR
  A[User Interaction] --> B[React Component]
  B --> C[TRPCReactProvider]
  C --> D[tRPC Procedure]
  D --> E[Server Context]
  E --> F[Drizzle Database]
  F --> G[PostgreSQL]
  G --> H[Real-time Updates]
  H --> I[UI Components]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `src/app/layout.tsx`: Root layout with theme, tRPC, and UploadThing providers
- `src/app/api/trpc/[trpc]/route.ts`: tRPC request handler endpoint
- `src/server/api/root.ts`: Primary tRPC router composition

### Core Modules
- `src/lib/auth.ts`: Authentication configuration with Better Auth and multi-tenancy
- `src/server/db/schema.ts`: Complete database schema with relations
- `src/features/`: Domain-specific UI components and logic
- `src/trpc/react.tsx`: tRPC React integration

### Configuration Approach
- `next.config.ts`: Next.js configuration with OpenNext Cloudflare integration
- `drizzle.config.ts`: Database migration configuration
- `tsconfig.json`: TypeScript path mapping (`@/*` to `src/*`)
- `package.json`: Scripts for development, building, and database operations

### External Dependencies
- `better-auth`: Authentication with organization support
- `@trpc/server`: Type-safe backend APIs
- `drizzle-orm`: Database ORM with PostgreSQL
- `uploadthing`: File upload infrastructure
- `resend`: Email delivery service

### Integration Points
- `src/server/email/resend.ts`: Email sending integration
- `src/app/api/uploadthing/core.ts`: File upload integration
- `cloudflare-env.d.ts`: Cloudflare environment typing
- `open-next.config.ts`: OpenNext deployment configuration

```mermaid
graph LR
  A[Frontend] --> B[tRPC Client]
  B --> C[tRPC Server]
  C --> D[Database]
  C --> E[Email Service]
  C --> F[File Storage]
  D --> G[PostgreSQL]
  E --> H[Resend]
  F --> I[UploadThing]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Multi-Tenant Organization Management
The platform supports organization-based multi-tenancy where each organization represents a cooperative, VSLA, or aggregator. Users belong to organizations through membership, and data access is scoped accordingly.

Key implementation files:
- `src/lib/auth.ts`: Organization plugin configuration
- `src/server/db/schema.ts`: Organization and member tables
- `src/features/admin/organizations/`: Admin organization management UI

```mermaid
erDiagram
    USER ||--o{ MEMBER : "is member of"
    ORGANIZATION ||--o{ MEMBER : "has members"
    ORGANIZATION ||--o{ FARMER : "manages"
    FARMER ||--o{ FARM : "owns"
    ORGANIZATION ||--o{ WAREHOUSE : "owns"
    WAREHOUSE ||--o{ STOCK_LOT : "contains"
    STOCK_LOT ||--o{ STOCK_MOVEMENT : "moves"
```

### Farmer and Farm Management
Comprehensive farmer lifecycle management including personal details, farm locations, yields, and team affiliations. Supports GPS coordinates for farm boundaries and yield tracking by season.

Key implementation files:
- `src/server/db/schema.ts`: Farmer, farm, and coordinate tables
- `src/app/(app)/farmers/[farmerId]/page.tsx`: Farmer detail page
- `src/app/(app)/farmers/[farmerId]/farms/page.tsx`: Farm management

### Financial Operations
Integrated financial systems including:
- Savings accounts for individuals and groups
- Loan management with approval workflows
- Input credit system for suppliers
- Marketplace purchase orders with payment tracking

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Pending
    Pending --> Approved: Admin Approval
    Approved --> Active: Disbursement
    Active --> Repaid: Full Payment
    Active --> Defaulted: Overdue
    Repaid --> Closed: Finalized
    Defaulted --> Closed: Written Off
```

### Inventory and Marketplace
End-to-end inventory management from commodity definition to warehouse stock and marketplace listings. Purchase orders connect buyers and sellers with delivery and payment tracking.

Key implementation files:
- `src/server/db/schema.ts`: Commodity, warehouse, stock, and PO tables
- `src/app/(admin)/admin/inventory/`: Inventory management
- `src/app/(admin)/admin/marketplace/`: Marketplace administration

### Authentication and Authorization
Sophisticated auth system with:
- Admin approval required for new signups
- Role-based access control (RBAC) for admins and organization members
- Phone number verification support
- API key management

The system uses Better Auth with custom plugins for admin roles, organization management, and API keys, providing a robust foundation for secure multi-tenant operations.

Sources:
- [package.json](package.json)
- [next.config.ts](next.config.ts)
- [tsconfig.json](tsconfig.json)
- [layout.tsx](src/app/layout.tsx)
- [route.ts](src/app/api/trpc/[trpc]/route.ts)
- [root.ts](src/server/api/root.ts)
- [trpc.ts](src/server/api/trpc.ts)
- [auth.ts](src/lib/auth.ts)
- [schema.ts](src/server/db/schema.ts)
</blog>
